title: What if we moved the clown fiesta to top lane
body:
Currently, getting your bot double killed, tower taken, and dragon taken feels pretty bad and snowballs games hard. What if we increased tower fortifications bot lane and removed them top lane. This would alleviate pressure bot lane by making it harder to instantly take tower after a good gank, meaning the game wouldn't snowball as hard 
off of a losing bot. Top lane would also become less of an island, meaning it would be more fun to watch LCS (cuz riot loves the LCS).

Although one may say moving the clown fiesta top lane would solve nothing and junglers would just camp top, think about the trade offs. 
1. Top lane does not have a dragon, meaning there is 
nothing to take after a gank (rift herald is basically impossible to kill pre- 18 mins)

2. It is harder to take a tower with fewer people, even with 
fewer resistances on the tower.

Thoughts?

Edit: Also, top laners are generally tanky, so even if they do snowball, they will not be able to solo carry the game like a Caitlyn or a vayne.

Bad idea pal  

4v2 you can both focus the person tanking the turret shot. 1 person has damage, the other has sustain to keep up that damage or CC to lock someone down under turret. It is not ideal obviously, but there is a higher chance to kill someone or maybe even 2 people. Not to mention if your team if the one who pulls it off, you set back their most valuable late game champion as well as control Dragon, one of the most valuable snowballing objectives.  

1v3, you are dead. You don't have really anything to fight back against 3 people and since most Top laners are generally tanky, they can tank a couple turret shots before having to juggle which means even focusing the person tanking will accomplish little. If it is your team doing the 3v1, you get one kill and a turret, meanwhile your bot is left completely open to ganks and you will still lose more than you gained.  
  

It is just not ideal in any circumstances to be top lane while there is a dragon and potential snowballing of the most powerful role, Marksmen.

It would make more sense from a numbers standpoint.

If the bot lane gets clowned:
2 kills for the enemy team
1 tower
1 dragon
Your hard carry is fucked

If the top lane gets clowned:
1 kill for the enemy team
1 tower
Your tank(y) ally is fucked

Top lane getting smacked around is the better of the two if your team is on the receiving end. There's less kills for the other team, your carry is still intact, and most people forget Rift Herald exists because dragons get better the more of them you grab.

Unfortunately, this is also the reason why there _aren't_ clown fiestas in the top lane; it's just not worth it. Oh wow, you beat down the enemy Malphite. Now he'll still ult into your team, still initiate like a god, and then get killed a full second shorter than he normally would. All that work keeping him underfed did almost nothing in the end.

That's why bot lane has such a target painted on it right now. Marksmen have more impact than ever before on the game since assassins got reworked to have counterplay and tanks have to dive deep into the weakest of the three mastery trees to grab CoC. In addition, the best non-tower objective sits right nearby, just asking to be another stack on the dragon carcass pile.

Control the bottom half of the map, and you control who wins the game. Simple as that.
